<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command
</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3
</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.72
</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global
</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Applies force to given object at given position. Force is defined as vector [x, y, z] in world space, position is vector [x, y, z] in model space. If you need to define force in model space, use [[vectorModelToWorld]] or [[vectorModelToWorldVisual]] commands first. The force applied as impulse. For more information see [http://docs.nvidia.com/gameworks/content/gameworkslibrary/physx/apireference/files/classPxRigidBody.html#a22b0a1ef0b6c5656a6063c5c38f5679c NVIDIA docs]
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature</title><part><name index="1"/><value>Informative</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>Since Arma 3 v2.03.147267 this command can be used on units. It will send the unit into unconscious ragdoll state, similar to how [[setUnconscious]] does it (see example 3). In multiplayer, the unit has to be [[local]] <template><title>Icon</title><part><name index="1"/><value>localArgument</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>32</value></part></template> on the computer that executed command. </value></part></template>
</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> object '''addForce''' [force, position]
</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> object: [[Object]] - PhysX object
</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> [force, position]: [[Array]]
</value></part><part><name>p3</name>=<value> force: [[Array]] - force vector (in world space) in format [x,y,z]
</value></part><part><name>p4</name>=<value> position: [[Array]] - model [[PositionRelative]] to which force is applied in format [x,y,z]
</value></part><part><name>p5</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p6</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]]
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> Apply force [0,1000,0] defined in world space (not factoring object actual positioning) to object position [1,0,0]:
<code>_object [[addForce]] [[0,1000,0],[1,0,0]];</code>
</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> Apply force [0,1000,0] defined in model space (relative to object) to object position [1,0,0]:
<code>_object [[addForce]] [_object [[vectorModelToWorld]] [0,1000,0],[1,0,0]];</code>
</value></part><part><name>x3</name>=<value> Since Arma 3 v2.03.147267, can be used on units: <code>[] [[spawn]] 
{
	bob [[addForce]] [bob [[vectorModelToWorld]] [0,-200,0], bob [[selectionPosition]] "rightfoot"];
	[[sleep]] 5;
	bob [[setUnconscious]] [[false]];
};</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[addTorque]], [[vectorModelToWorld]], [[vectorModelToWorldVisual]]
</value></part></template>
